data.title: North Carolina State University
data.meta_description: Trent Pennix (6) TE - 2023 SEASON: • Unique player who has played running back and tight end during his career. His OC calls him “maybe the most unique playe...
data.text:
2023 SEASON:

• Unique player who has played running back and tight end during his career. His OC calls him “maybe the most unique player I’ve ever been around.

• Scored on a pass from KC Concepcion in the win at VT.

• Had the longest rushing play of his career - a 60-yard rush - in the Pop-Tarts Bowl vs. Kansas State. It was on a fake punt.

• Missed the Clemson game with an injury.

• Scored two touchdowns in the win over Marshall, one on a career-long 62 yards reception.

• Named to the preseason watch list for the Mackey Award.

2022 SEASON:

• Suffered an injury in the season opener and missed the next six games. He returned vs. Va Tech and scored a touchdown. Injured again vs. BC and missed the Louisville game. Tried to come back vs. UNC.

• In for 176 snaps for the season, he started all five games in which he played.

• Missed 2022 spring practice as he continued to rehab following surgery.

2021 SEASON:

• Scored on a 29-yard reception vs. Louisville, on a 45-yarder at FSU and had a nine-yard score vs. UNC.

• Pulled down a career-high 97 receiving yards at FSU on three catches.

• All three of his touchdown receptions in 2021 came in the last five games.

• Left the Wake Forest game early with an injury.

• Had a 40-yard rush on a fake punt vs. Miami.

2020 SEASON:

• Scored his third career touchdown in the win over Virginia - he was in for just four snaps from scrimmage.

2019 SEASON:

• One of just two players in the Power 5 conferences to score a touchdown as a freshman in 2018 and then again as a redshirt freshman in 2019.

• Started the Wake Forest game at tight end due to injuries there, but had to move back to RB after Bam Knight went out with an injury.

• Scored the only touchdown for the Wolfpack in the win over Syracuse - a 32-yard catch from Thayer Thomas.

2018 SEASON:

• Redshirted the season.

• Had the fourth-longest reception for the Pack in 2018, a 56-yarder from wide receiver Thayer Thomas vs. Georgia State.

• Rushed for 68 yards on 22 carries for the season.

• Scored a touchdown on a one-yard pass in the win over Ga. State.

HIGH SCHOOL:

• Played running back, safety at local Sanderson High School for coach Ben Kolstad. Helped team advance to the NC 4AA state quarterfinals.

• Career Stats: Totaled 500 carries for 3,039 yards (6.1 avg.) and 35 touchdowns. Turned in 13 games with over 100 yards rushing. Also had 48 catches for 648 yards and five TDs. Totaled 4,166 all-purpose yards in his career.

• Senior Stats: Tallied 201 carries for 1,247 yards and 16 touchdowns. Also caught 34 passes for 397 yards and three scores. Totaled 1,694 all-purpose yards as a senior. Also turned in 15 tackles and two interceptions on defense. A team captain

• Honors: A two-time Cap 7 all-conference selection.

• Junior Stats: Rushed for 167 carries for 1,215 yards and 12 scores.

• Rankings: No. 37 running back nationally and the No. 28 prospect in North Carolina by rivals.com.

PERSONAL

• High School teammate of former Wolfpack DT (Detroit Lions) Alim McNeill.
